titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-08-13T11:35-0400

did.abstract: Records of the Chaminade, including the group's constitution, correspondence, a scrapbook of news clippings, loose clippings, press releases, programs, and one black-and-white photograph. Materials date from 1923 to 1952.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Chaminade records, 1977.204, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Chaminade was a Brooklyn women's choral society founded in 1898 to study and perform choral music.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Records of the Chaminade, including the group's constitution, correspondence, a scrapbook of news clippings, loose clippings, press releases, programs, and one black-and-white photograph. Materials date from 1923 to 1952.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Gift of Mrs. Thurston C. Bassett, 1958.
